page.title: 01Quiet South Shropshire Hills
page.content: Typical backwater of south Shropshire with beautiful scenery and quiet single track lanes. Many more people lived here in 1086 than today-total population today only about two hundred. Major land use now is farming, especially sheep, but land is 50% + marginal and soon much of it may be derelict or afforested if or when the E.E.C withdraws its subsidies. Few farms and fewer people working on the land. Most people working well outside the area. A huge council tip catering for much of south Shropshire is perhaps a foretaste of things to come. A largely forgotten area-but beautiful especially on the 'top' where we and a few others live.
